comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Milton E. Ailes, Assistant Secretary of the Treasury.

comment.author: 92987904@N00
comment._content: Milton E. Ailes -- A chapter in the book "130 Pen Pictures of Live Men" By Orlando Oscar Stealey, 1910, via Google Books

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: It seems that Ailes resigned from the Treasury in 1903 -- see NYT from March 29, 1903 at query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9804E4DA1E30E733A... -- he then joined Riggs Bank as Vice-President, eventually becoming President of the bank in 1921. He died suddenly in 1925. In the 1914-1915 period there was a dispute between Riggs and the Treasury, also reported in the NYT, e.g., in query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E00E2DE153EE033A...

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: This does appear to be Milton E. Ailes. There is a photo of him from 1924 in one of the Library of Congress Prints and Photographs Division's other photojournalism collections, the National Photo Company Collection: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/npcc.25364 -- looking older, but similar expression(!). We'll fill out his name in our source description and reload the description to Flickr. Thanks!

comment.author: 36386147@N07
comment._content: This is a picture of my Dad's grandfather! I have never seen a picture of him until now! Very neat!
